data.post_content: Mannat Thukral 11/11/18 This article discusses Snap Inc, the parent company of the popular social media platform Snapchat. Snap Inc. had its IPO on the New York Stock Exchange in March of 2017. Barring some times, this stock has had a consistent negative trend since its IPO. According to the article, Snap has yet to report a profit as a publicly traded company, but the CEO Evan Spiegel has vision of profitability as soon as 2019. The article reports that while this quarter Snap’s revenues are higher, by almost 5% more than expected ($297.7 million as compared to $283 million expected), their core user base declined by 2 million users. This is due to the app’s redesign in early 2018 and its poor reception by its main user base. Snap included a more advertiser-friendly page and this drove many people to abandon usage of the app. This phenomena shows how some pragmatic business decisions can drive consumers away. Snap presumably redesigned its app to attract more advertisers and thus increase advertising revenue on their app. This was a smart business decision because Snapchat is a free app to use and their only consumer-contributed revenues would be from their sale of Snapchat merchandise and Snapchat Spectacles. The company saw a way to grow their top line and likely knew this would drive away users but would have thought the additional revenue to be worth losing users over. In my opinion, Snap made the right decision because they are now publicly traded and thus what matters the most is their revenues and profits. As an IPO that has consistently done extremely poorly in the past, I think it is a good goal they are working towards. If the trend continues the goal of profitability is definitely attainable and I believe that this decision will also help them finance some of the costs of building a better company has a whole. They have already made leeway into more strategic growth by recruiting Jeremi Gorman, head of global advertising sales at Amazon (for obvious reasons, and Jared Grusd, chief executive of the Huffington Post to be Snap’s new strategy chief (again, there is a pattern). They also have added a new director of product design for its innovation team, Snap Lab, in October. If they continue to grow their revenue, the can make even more strides into being a better company for the common man to invest in. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/snap-loses-users-but-wrings-more-money-from-those-who-stayed-1540499038

Tatiana Economopoulos 11/11/18 In today’s society of constantly advancing technology, people are always finding ways to use technology to tackle real world issues. Artificial intelligence is one of the newer elements of technology that uses machines to resolve identities, whether people or things. In the article, “Another Use for A.I.: Finding Millions of Unregistered Voters” by Steve Lohr, he describes the way these new uses of technology can help increase voter access and voter registration data. This new technology, called ERIC (Electronic Registration Information Center) can not only help state legislation reach out to people who are know to be eligible to vote but unregistered, but also can help minimize the small risk of voter fraud. The success of all these measures is seen through the growing number of eligible people who now registered to vote in the participating states. The growing number of people contacted by ERIC who registered to vote is one of the most successful aspects of the program.
In my opinion, this program really targets one of the biggest issues in American society today which is the amount of people voting. In many cases, people simply do not vote because they are uneducated on either how to register or how/where they need to vote. ERIC can not only reach out to the specific people who fill either of these criteria, but also encourage them to follow the correct steps. Being part of a new rising group of potential voters, it is extremely important to be able to share the correct information with those who need it. Even more importantly, ERIC can help make sure that our democratic system remains that way by eliminating potential voter fraud through people voting twice at different locations, registering under two different addresses, or any other break in the system.
Overall, this new program not only shows the advancement of technology, but also the way technology can be used to tackle nationwide issues. ERIC will not only help register millions of eligible voters, but also protect the system as it exists today.
Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/05/technology/unregistered-voter-rolls.html?rref=collection%2Fsectioncollection%2Fbusiness&action=click&contentCollection=business&region=stream&module=stream_unit&version=latest&contentPlacement=2&pgtype=sectionfront

Mannat Thukral 11/11/18 This article discusses Snap Inc, the parent company of the popular social media platform Snapchat. Snap Inc. had its IPO on the New York Stock Exchange in March of 2017. Barring some times, this stock has had a consistent negative trend since its IPO. According to the article, Snap has yet to report a profit as a publicly traded company, but the CEO Evan Spiegel has vision of profitability as soon as 2019. The article reports that while this quarter Snap’s revenues are higher, by almost 5% more than expected ($297.7 million as compared to $283 million expected), their core user base declined by 2 million users. This is due to the app’s redesign in early 2018 and its poor reception by its main user base. Snap included a more advertiser-friendly page and this drove many people to abandon usage of the app. This phenomena shows how some pragmatic business decisions can drive consumers away. Snap presumably redesigned its app to attract more advertisers and thus increase advertising revenue on their app. This was a smart business decision because Snapchat is a free app to use and their only consumer-contributed revenues would be from their sale of Snapchat merchandise and Snapchat Spectacles. The company saw a way to grow their top line and likely knew this would drive away users but would have thought the additional revenue to be worth losing users over. In my opinion, Snap made the right decision because they are now publicly traded and thus what matters the most is their revenues and profits. data.post_content: Subrina Oaishe 11/18/18 Amazon has finally chosen its new second headquarter (“HQ2”) after a long search across North America that started in September 2017. But the surprises are that rather than choosing one location Amazon could not resist nor deny the charms of two cities and thus resulting in “HQ2” locations being- Long Island City, NY and Crystal City, Northern Virginia. What started with 20 different choices ranging from Dallas, Nashville, Los Angeles, Miami, Denver, Pittsburg, and etc. now has been narrowed down to only two final locations. The reason for Amazon choosing Long Island City was partly its history as an industrial hotspot for a while now. Long Island City is a continuously growing neighborhood that lies against the East River and is highly “accessible by multiple subway lines, the Long Island Rail Road and two ferry stops”. It is also close to La Guardia and John F. Kennedy International airports. There were 4 other neighborhoods in the New York area that Amazon's eyes were lingering on but it seemed the accessibility and the attraction of this ever-growing place had won out Amazon’s heart. The second location, Crystal County, Northern Virginia was also chosen due to similar reasons. “Its sheer size and proximity to Washington, Reagan National Airport, metro stops, and other transportation, made it an attractive prospect for Amazon’s ambitious second-headquarters plan, according to people who have been involved in the discussions”. There were also other various factors that Amazon looked at such as the Industry and Workforce, Tech Labor Force, Education, Transportation, and Housing, and Culture within the borders of those cities compared to the national average. The results of these comparisons show why the need for Amazon’s “HQ2” in Long Island City and Crystal City with how well the two excelled above and beyond in majority categories against the US national average. But otherwise finally going public with their final choices, Amazon’s is giving hope for these two city’s local population and government. Through choosing two locations Amazon is hoping to bring in a higher amount of job then when choosing only one but also not drastically affect the housing market nearby to make living inaccessible to others. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-chooses-new-york-city-and-northern-virginia-for-additional-headquarters-1542075336

Deanna Pisacreta 11/18/18 Since Snow White debuted in 1937, Disney has struck pretty true to their mold – damsel in distress gets rescued by a handsome man and the pair live happily ever after. The princesses alone are a multi-billion-dollar aspect of the Disney corporation; however, the time may have arrived for a re-brand. Modern parents are wrestling with how to explain their childhood favorites to their children in a world with #MeToo among other rising feminist concerns. For example, was it okay for the prince to kiss Aurora in Sleeping Beauty since she was asleep and couldn’t consent? Additionally, in relatively all the princess movies, males dominate the dialogue. Even in modern movies like Frozen men control more of the script then female counterparts. Merida in Brave is the only female that speaks more in her movie then the men in the movie. Clearly, something has to change. However, to the executives at Disney the necessary change is scary. If audiences to not take to a new age princess, the company could lose billions in dollars in revenue from movie sales, to dolls, dresses, and the list goes on. A recently released clip from the upcoming movie “Ralph Breaks the Internet” depicts the princesses as regular people and even has them questioning why people assume they need men to save them. This will just be the beginning of the new age princess and the reaction from audience with have drastic repercussions for the company. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/beauty-and-the-backlash-disneys-modern-princess-problem-1542430801
data.post_title: How to Characterize a Princess in the 21st Century

data.post_content: Yina Torres 11/18/18 In a competitive market it is no surprise that companies are willing to take bigger risks to ensure that they are keeping up. Well what if it’s at the expense of the investors? That is exactly what happened to Neiman Marcus and PetSmart corporate debt investors. High yield bonds such as corporate debt has been in high demand for these companies resulting in investors accepting to buy debt with very few protections. Unbeknowingly to most investors, PetSmart and Neiman Marcus were transferring valuable assets to unrestricted subsidiaries. This hurts debt investors since now there is a new group of lenders who have first priority to those assets and they now have second priority. Neiman Marcus lenders have stated that they were okay with the company moving the asset MyTheresa to parent company Ares Management since it was minor. However, there are no restrictions for these companies to move larger assets. Lenders continuing to purchase debt off of companies doing this are promoting the use of unrestricted subsidiaries. If this continues debt investors will face severe financial consequences if there is a bankruptcy. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-case-of-the-disappearing-collateral-1542283201?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=1

Arya Sanghavi 11/18/18 Falling asleep in class, I often wake up to the person sitting in front of me finishing last night’s assignment on their MacBook. On my right is someone streaming Netflix and on my left is someone playing Fortnite, both on their Macbooks. From the iPod to the iTouch to the iPhone, Apple has taken the tech world by storm. We are enveloped by their products, whether it be on the subway, school or even on our kitchen table. Other companies have made their mark too such as Samsung and Sony. Dell, however, was once a tech sensation with their products seen as revolutionary and selling through the roof. In the article I recently read, “Dell Technologies Confirms Deal That Would Mark Return to Public Markets” the company is trying to recapture their market share and once known glory. PC maker Dell Technologies said Monday that it plans to buy the publicly traded DVMT, which tracks VMware. Each share of Dell Technologies Class V stock will be converted into about 1.37 shares of Class C common stock, Dell Technologies said. The implied value of the Class V shares is $109 a share, it added. We live in a cutthroat world, where the consumer demand is highly volatile. What may have been considered revolutionary yesterday can be seen as archaic today. It’s important to step outside your comfort zone and venture out. Diversification is key in today’s tech savvy world. There’s no cap on creativity and the will to be anything but ordinary is key. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/dell-technologies-confirms-deal-that-would-mark-return-to-public-markets-1530531406?tesla=y

Michelle Nazar 11/18/18

Facebook, a popular social media website amongst all ages, has been having a tough year. Not only in stock price, but its reputation and employee morale has been declining. An internal survey taken by around 29,000 employees revealed that the overall workplace attitude had turned colder and more bitter compared to a year ago. Recently, many employees are not hopeful for Facebooks future as a successful company and some intend to stay with the company for less than a year. Many employees feel this way because they feel that the leaders of the company are having issues responding to many controversies internally and externally. Employees state that they were worried about “Facebook’s sharpened focus on growth and frustrated over a “lack of innovation” within the company”. In my opinion, these complaints and concerns from the employees are seen through the app from a user’s perspective. In my experience with using Facebook, its lost its reputation as somewhere we can go directly to for social media purposes. We lean more towards Instagram now. Maybe it is because all of the excess suggested posts for us, or the media that is trying to spread false information about politics and other things. There is just so much on Facebook that is not filtered through enough for our own personal feeds that it becomes a hassle to use. We have other apps for messaging and another app strictly for pictures, and Facebook is starting to seem like a bland middle option between the two. Also, Facebook’s stock has been declining because of the backlash Mark Zuckerberg has been getting through the media as well. They make it seem like everything he is doing is wrong, which affects the reputation of his business. Overall, I am not surprised that Facebook stock price is declining.

Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-morale-takes-a-tumble-along-with-stock-price-1542200400

data.post_content: Marin Marinov 11/18/18 Sundar Pichai is currently the chief executive of Google. He grew up in Chennai India where he did not have much. In fact, he lived in a “modest house, shared with tenants” (Gelles 2018) where he had to sleep on the living room floor. The worst part was that there was a drought while he was growing up and now he cannot sleep without having a bottle of water right next to his bed. Despite these shortcomings, Pichai was a voracious reader and his daily activities consisted almost entirely of playing cricket with friends and reading. Pichai says he never felt like lacked anything. To him, those two things were the totality of life (Gelles, 2018). He later attended Stanford before starting to officially work for Google. When he was asked whether Google had remained the same, he responded by saying that the optimism and idealism have remained despite the company’s recent increase in failures. He also notes that there are a plethora of challenges, but those challenges are what make everything exciting. Another Topic that is talked about in the interview is censorship, specifically, how can pornography be easily censored while propaganda, misinformation and disturbing content aimed at kids cannot. Pichai answered by saying that it is quite perplexing to know what is “O.K” in society and what is “Not O.K”. There is a difference between somebody using their freedom of speech to state an opinion and explicit content that is not meant to be shown to children. Pichai concludes the interview by stating that Silicon Valley has retained its optimism, but there is a small shift. That optimism has tampered with a sense of deliberation. There is a lot more thought put into the actions of Google. Pichai concludes that technology will never solve humanity’s problems and it is wrong to think that technology is the problem and also the solution we need to rely on.     This article brings about a lot of different topics and ideas. The first one being the idea what is right and what is wrong. Is it right to ban pornography but not ban somebody who is saying that climate change does exist? Climate change as a matter a fact does exist, why? Because there have been tests done with infrared radiation through carbon dioxide molecules that show that there is an increase in carbon dioxide in the atmosphere. Despite having the proof, you will still see people that will disregard it just because that is how they feel about the topic. Does that mean that a business should lie about or exaggerate on their success? Should we remove the right to free speech? The answer is it’s complicated because whatever happens, it can be abused and adulterated. Everything is a choice and the actions that you take. Society has started to evolve very fast and there Pichai points out that there is a lot more thought that needs to put because Google needs to know whether it will meet the customer’s demands and whether the customers will not find it controversial. Anything that is released to the public can be rated and judged, which can ultimately make or break a company.    Another important thing that Pichai talks about is optimism in the face of obstacles. Obstacles are not necessarily a negative thing, but rather a catalyst to improve oneself. Problems are there to be thought about. If everything was perfect, there would be no need for society to improve and technology would never advance. Speaking of technology, Pachai emphasizes that we cannot rely on technology to fix humanities’ problems. Technology was created by humans and humans are responsible for making the right choices and using the technology properly. I very much agree with this statement as I believe it not the technology but what to do with it that makes it either useful or worthless. On top of that, it is our choice to purchase whatever technology we want, we should not be moved by what the majority uses if we know better. This article motivates me to work harder and to be more optimistic in the face of problems. It reminded me to enjoy the fact that I am challenged as well how much I have grown from facing a multitude of problems. Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/08/business/sundar-pichai-google-corner-office.html The never-ending battle of society and technology

Through choosing two locations Amazon is hoping to bring in a higher amount of job then when choosing only one but also not drastically affect the housing market nearby to make living inaccessible to others. Deanna Pisacreta 11/25/18 For many of us, we think of Black Friday as the most profitable day of the year for retailers such as Macy’s, Target, and Walmart. However, between markdowns and a decrease in foot traffic to stores, profit margins for the day are trending lower than usual for many retailers. While many people still rush to the stores before dawn for the nostalgia of it, a lot of customers are switching to online shopping rather than fighting the crowds and long lines in store. Between this decrease in traffic, the rising cost of labor and merchandise, and the high markdowns associated with the day; Black Friday is deeply cutting into many retailer’s profit margins for the holiday season. Some retailers, such as Walmart, are changing their strategies to accommodate and attract more online shoppers in an effort to fix the issue. However, some like Macy’s and Target are putting more money into refurbishing outdated stores in order to attract more customers. This strategy will be costlier in the short-term, but they are hoping it will resolve the margin problem in the long term, as well as attract more consumers throughout the year and not just on Black Friday. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/retail-stores-win-back-shoppers-not-profits-1542979413

data.post_content: Arya Sanghavi 11/25/18 Do the ends justify the means? In this case, quite the contrary. In an article I recently read, “Finra Arbitrators Let Thousands of Brokers Purge Infraction Records”, more than thousands of brokers have scrubbed their records clean of complaints by customers and employers, allowing them to hide information from potential investors. The scrubbing process, known as expungement, is overseen by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, the industry-funded brokerage regulator. Expungement is meant to be a rare event, regulators say. But the study, which analyzed Broker Check records and other regulatory information, found that arbitrators granted requests nearly 70% of the time. One who did was Stuart Siegel. The Florida broker in 2013 declared on his Broker Check page that he had enjoyed an “unblemished record over a 35-year career in the securities industry with never having been accused of misconduct by any customer.” Two years after the complaint was scrubbed, Finra filed unrelated civil charges against Mr. Siegel alleging he had used tens of thousands of dollars of charitable funds he oversaw for his personal benefit. Mr. Siegel repaid the money and in 2014 agreed to be barred from the securities industry without admitting or denying the allegations, according to Finra records. Like Mr. Seigel, there are a plethora of business professionals who have violated codes of ethics and conduct in order to profit. The scams aren’t limited to the fields of finance however. Worldwide, in any job, there are always going to be those who try to level the playing field through playing the system. Being honorable and ethical is a choice, one we should make without any hesitation and encourage others to do so as well. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/finra-arbitrators-let-thousands-of-brokers-purge-infraction-records-1542459600?tesla=y

These last two weeks were met with a sharp decrease in various stocks around the country. This decrease had led to an intense discussion within the Federal Reserve on what steps to take next given recently troubled circumstances, in particular, the nation's interest rates. “Fed officials have signaled in recent days they plan to proceed with another quarter percentage point increase in their benchmark short-term interest rate when they meet Dec. 19, marking their fourth rate increase this year”. However, some data shown in the last Fed’s meeting have split the team in half regarding the decision to raise interest rates.
“The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell sharply Tuesday to its sixth drop in eight trading days, a move that has wiped out its gains for the year”. Given these stock troubles, investors are worried the raised interest rate can lead to an “economic weakness in the US and abroad” then what Fed officials may be able to count on. Important individuals such as Stanley Druckenmiller, investor, hedge fund manager, and a philanthropist, are vocalizing the need for the Fed to slow down and to simply observe the market before securing a decision. Then there is Ray Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates, LP, who “argued that the Fed’s interest-rate hikes will hurt asset prices and that such share weakness will, in turn, undercut the economy”. These opinions were then heavily complicated by our President, Donald Trump, who downright went to central banks to campaign for the need to halt interest rate increases. His response to this matter, “ I’d like to see the Fed with a lower interest rate. We have much more of a Fed problem than we have a problem with anyone else.”
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s response to this is that “market conditions are “one of many factors” the Fed considers when deciding where to set its benchmark rates”. Otherwise, there have been heated debates within the walls of Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan Chase, Wall Street, Morgan Stanley, Nomura Securities about this matter, so now all there is to do is wait and see the outcome of this case.
Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/federal-reserve-not-likely-swayed-by-recent-stock-market-declines-1542747329?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=2
data.post_title: Fed’s Interest In Rising Rates Even Amongst The Declining Market

It is that time of the year again, where we all make the “annual pilgrimage to stores on Black Friday”. However, this one is different because this one is expected to be one of the strongest holiday seasons in years. Although people are buying more this holiday season, it is more through online shopping rather than in store. It is just so much easier to get anything you want delivered to you in about two to three days rather than going into the store and standing on the extremely long line with other customers for the same deal. On Thanksgiving, U.S. shoppers “spent $3.7 billion online, a 28% increase from a year earlier”. This all leads to how it affects the retail stores that are located in shopping malls and local towns. They are left with extra inventory and an aspiration to fix up outdated stores. In order to fix this issue and make it easier for the consumer in stores, the Kohl’s Corp. CEO says the chain will reduce the amount of inventory it carries and will buy closer to Thanksgiving. I think this is a great idea because not only will there be less extra inventory, but the inventory will also be more in with the time and up to date rather than old styles of clothing or toys. Although many companies believe that their strategies will call for more people to come into their retail store on Black Friday, I believe that over the years people will realize how much easier it is to shop online and will do that instead, forcing companies to create better markups online. Personally, I went into the mall the night of Black Friday and saw that it was not only emptier than usual (I was able to find parking easily), but there was also not a lot of options that I liked, so I did not buy anything. However, I went online the next day and ordered clothing and accessories. It was fun though, to go in with friends and feel the thrill of the discounts. 

Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/retail-stores-win-back-shoppers-not-profits-1542979413?emailToken=8cb97e2395ef0e1e0f1989946f2a0cdfiOWB22fwkGXhgpYJztKMcCWEnbB1Knww3PN7UHWYYBiQMPWazuYc2MbQUHVxQ57vy+YbqS3qp2qWexDFwS44aIDF5Ac3JcfZ98i88Hc4A3A%3D&reflink=article_imessage_share

On Monday November 19, 2018, David’s Bridal, the largest wedding retailer in the United States filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Delaware. The company has more than $400 million in debt as of Monday.  David’s Bridals started as an individual bridal salon in Florida in 1950 and quickly expanded. In 2012, Clayton, Dubilier and Rice purchased the company in a 1.05 billion leveraged buyout, which made them one of the many retailers that have struggled with their debt loads after being acquired. The decline in marriage rates is factor which played apart in the growing debts. Online competition and wholesale prices, have driven customers away David’s Bridal. Before taking steps to declare bankruptcy, David’s Bridal negotiated a deal with creditors for $60 million in new financing and a recommitment for a $125 million revolving credit facility.  Stores have not been announced to close as of yet, and the company plans to exit bankruptcy in early January.

David’s Bridal is an amazing store; my mother even had bought her wedding dress from there. I think that the business in weddings is very delicate and unpredictable, where as there may be good business one season and bad another. Due to this fact, I feel it may take a good time for David’s Bridal to pay off their debts. Wholesale shopping from Asia and other places have gotten very popular from reviews and Youtube videos, which has given them more exposure. The exposure then tends to lead consumers to the most affordable choice, which may not be David’s Bridal. The rapid changes of popular styles and fads may also impact consumers buying from David’s Bridal. David’s Bridal is capable of lowering their debt enough to suffice closing stores. I think the steps they have taken, such as the deal with creditors for new financing and recommitment, demonstrate the companies drive to fix their financial standings.

Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/19/business/davids-bridal-bankruptcy.html

Toys 'R' us is a large chain retailer of children's toys and products who filed for bankruptcy on September 2017 due to too much debt. Since then various Toys 'R' Us stores have been shut down around America and the company liquidated its shares and sold its Canadian, European, and Asian units to other groups. However even after this recent tragedy, “the newly independent Toys ‘R’ Us Asia” has seen a recent boom in popularity. “The surviving Asian operation spans more than 450 stores in 10 markets, with 168 in Japan and 166 China” focusing on a smaller store layout of 10,000 square feet, often located inside malls, compared to the old gigantic American Layout of 40,000 square feet.
Toys 'R' Us Asia has reported a loss in revenue for 4 years till 2016, but in 2017 the company emphasized its positive growth, nevertheless, this does not mean the company is in the green light for upcoming years. Asian “e-commerce giants Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and JD.com have taken a huge swath of China’s retail market. More people bought toys, games, and books online than from specialist children’s retail stores in the second half of last year, according to a study of 3,000 internet users by Mintel”. To redirect customers attention to brick and mortar stores like Toys 'R'` Us, they themselves have to now be extra careful of the way they present themselves to the Asian consumers to keep the steady profit going. The stores’ focuses are on “development-related toys, as parents become more focused on their children’s education” and also “in-store activities” to engage parents and children into this buying experience. The new independent Toys 'R' Us Asia is going through a new period of change after its recent incidents to rebrand itself and to again establish themselves into a stable market.
Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/toys-r-us-gears-up-for-holiday-salesin-asia-1543062604?mod=searchresults&page=1&pos=1

Its ability to provide free 2 day shipping on most products, a streaming and music service, and 2 hour delivery from local supermarkets for its subscription makes the typical American feel like they are in good hands. Most things that people might want to buy, furniture, electronics, school supplies, most likely have a cheaper option on amazon.com. Toys 'R' us is a large chain retailer of children's toys and products who filed for bankruptcy on September 2017 due to too much debt. To redirect customers attention to brick and mortar stores like Toys 'R'` Us, they themselves have to now be extra careful of the way they present themselves to the Asian consumers to keep the steady profit going. The stores’ focuses are on “development-related toys, as parents become more focused on their children’s education” and also “in-store activities” to engage parents and children into this buying experience. The new independent Toys 'R' Us Asia is going through a new period of change after its recent incidents to rebrand itself and to again establish themselves into a stable market.

data.post_content: Deanna Pisacreta 12/01/18 Currently Juul is the largest e-cigarette producer in the United States, valued at $16 billion dollars. It dominates the market for smokers trying to quit traditional cigarettes, and it has captured a large amount of underage consumers. It is because of this underage consumption that is has recently come under major fire by the FDA. This government crackdown threatened both Juul and other e-cigarette producers, and the company has already agreed to stop retailing many of its flavored products like mango and crème pods due to their underage appeal.  Despite this discontinuation the FDA is still out for blood, investigating the company’s marketing strategy and even product design to discover the underage appeal and help prevent teenage use. Currently, The Altria Group, a large tobacco company that produces traditional cigarettes such as Marlboro, is in negotiations to buy minority stake in Juul Labs. Right now Juul Labs is privately owned, so they don’t have shareholder funds to fall back on. If the negotiations work out Altria will have a greater foothold into the e-cigarette market and Juul will have access to the funding it needs to fight back against the FDA. A win for both companies. Altria is currently worth $103 billion, falling about 13 percent in the last year. With a decline in traditional smoking and a rise in e-cigarettes and vapes, an investment into Juul’s share of the market will become essential for Altria to uphold its value. Tobacco prevention advocates are speaking out against this buy in because of Altria’s history of trying to lure in teen smokers. Pumping this money into the e-cigarette market will be a massive setback for anti-smoking efforts. Juul dominates 70 percent of the e-cigarette market right now, and with an investment buy Altria that share will only continue to grow. Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/28/business/altria-juul-stake.html

data.post_content: Arya Sanghavi 12/01/18 Every week, I run down to my local CVS in Forest Hills, Queens to get my gallon of milk. Other days it’s been a bottle of Nyquil pills for the migraine I’ve been having. Either way, I’ve never seen CVS as anything other than my milk supply and Medicare. This is because CVS is a household image known for tools needed by the average man. Recently, however, in an article I read, “CVS Completes $70 Billion Acquisition of Aetna” it plans to expand their horizons and acquire a more significant and powerful vision. CVS HealthCorp. completed its nearly $70 billion acquisition of Aetna Inc.,forging a new industry giant and starting the clock ticking on ambitious goals of curbing health-care costs and improving consumers’ experience. In an interview, CVS Chief Executive Larry Merlo said the merged company has the right combination to smooth the fragmented health-care experience for consumers. “We have the capabilities to connect the dots in a very differentiated way,” he said. However, the combined company faces significant challenges in bringing together its diverse set of health assets, including CVS’s sprawling network of pharmacies, a pharmacy-benefit manager and Aetna’s employer insurance, Medicare and Medicaid managed-care businesses. Aetna will be operated as a stand-alone unit, and CVS will continue using the brand in reference to its insurance products. It's important to branch out and diversify, moreover it’s admirable to have an entrepreneurial vision. While it may have the glory, achieving these goals can be so expensive one might not even break even. It’s important to take risks but calculated as well. Amalgamating two businesses together needs to be a smooth transition, just like two families. The new merger may not have been as optimistic as Larry Merlo had aspired it to be, but it still has an immense scope. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/cvs-completes-70-billion-acquisition-of-aetna-1543423322

Marie-Elise Milius 12/01/18
General Motors chairman and Ceo Mary Barra, announced that the company plans to end production in 5 factories over the United States and Canada. As a direct result, more than 14,80 people will lose their jobs in the US and Canada. This cutback marks the company’s first significant downfall since it had gone bankrupt last decade. Approximately $4.5 billion would be cut from the company's annual cost by the end of 2022. This is the company's effort to adjust to the weak sales of the sedan cars. “Sales of sedans and other passenger cars have been sliding industry wide for several years as low gasoline prices have prompted more consumers to opt for roomier sport-utility vehicles and trucks.” GM wants to move spending on its core business of engineering and building cars to their focus. The company has announced the cuts would reduce its overall annualized spending on capital investments by approximately $1.5 billion. Shares of the company rose 4.8% on Monday to $37.65.
General Motors  has shared with the public their reasoning for the slashes in thousands of jobs and the end of productions in several companies, but I have very mixed feelings about how they are going about it. On one hand, I think it is too much at one time. Thousands of families will be affected by plan. Many may have a hard time finding work, which will not allow them to provide for their families. On the other hand, I think it is important for a company to work in their best interest. Companies must make a profit to keep growing, but I think General Motors should have closed about one or two to see how they will perform and then decide whether or not they will need to close more production factories. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/gm-says-it-will-cut-15-of-salaried-workforce-in-north-america-1543246232?fbclid=IwAR3CB5beDuK_1KTsIbUXUsXnBgBUXimI6RSDHOQhHAOeHiDo77zBi-DMP pk

data.post_content: Irene Tsahas 12/03/18 Since Black Friday marks the unofficial beginning of the Christmas shopping season, it’s safe to say that madness has begun. With each year, the holiday season creeps upon us earlier and earlier, but the momentum of this holiday season is only getting stronger. According to the article “Holiday Spending Should Be Strong. And Then?,” many Americans are in good spirits about the economy heading into the holiday shopping season. Customers are expected to open their wallets as wage growth is picking up and the unemployment rate is at the lowest it has been in nearly half a century. Therefore, retailers should be ecstatic about the high consumer confidence and expected 4.1 percent increase in holiday spending in comparison to last year. Although last year’s holiday season was the best for retailers in more than a decade, Americans are feeling even better this year with the economy on track for its best annual performance since 2005, sharp decline in gas prices, and recent tax cuts. However, the combination of rising interest rates, a weakening housing market, and new tariffs set to take place in January means the economy could begin to slow in 2019. So the real question is: how much longer will this good cheer last? While many are accusing Ben Casselman of playing the role of Scrooge in anticipation of the prosperous shopping season, I think it’s important to be aware of the negative cross-currents that could occur in the economy next year. Recently, the stock market has been falling which is concerning as the stock market is an early warning system before a recession is about to occur. Also, the decline in the stock market along with the decreasing housing market indicates bad news in the foreseeable future. I don’t think Casselman is necessarily Scrooge; maybe he’s just being realistic. Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/22/business/economy/holiday-retail-spending.htm

data.post_content: Brian Dinavitser 12/06/18 The stock market is a key indicator of the American economy. The actions of American executives can always be assessed by how they impact the stock market. According to New York Times article, “Trump Warns China That He’s ‘Tariff Man,’ Spooking Stock Investors”, by Matt Phillips and Alan Rappeport, President Trump met with the President of China, Xi Jinping, on December 3rd , 2018. American officials reported that the meeting was successful as the two parties agreed to stop the trade war by not levying more tariffs for 90 days. The article states that the countries will, “work toward a formal agreement.” Investors saw this event as a positive and as a result there was a rise in the stock market. Then, on Tuesday, December 4, 2018, President Trump tweeted, “....I am a Tariff Man. When people or countries come in to raid the great wealth of our Nation, I want them to pay for the privilege of doing so.” This tweet wiped out all the confidence created on Monday and the stock market began to decline. More specifically, the S&P 500 declined more than three percent and a large company such as Boeing fell 4.9 percent (Phillips and Rappeport). The events of the past two days clearly signal that the trade war between China and the United States will continue and a long-term agreement is may not happen. The authors express deeper concerns with the stock market as it is showing signs of a possible recession in the near future. If the trend of the stock market continues then the interest rates on long-term United States government bonds will fall below short-term US government bonds. According to the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, this type of activity has led to, “nine recessions since 1955.” The global economy is in a generally declining with the exception of the United States. Since the United States is a major party in global trade, it is expected that the American economy will also fall. President Trump is a self-proclaimed economic genius, but engaging in a trade war is never beneficial to the economy. If the United States and China reach a long-term trade agreement, then the world economy would likely recover. Investors will regain their confidence and the stock market will rise. The true legacy of a president is determined by their economic achievements. As of today, unemployment is historically low and the economy is set to have its best year since 2005 (Phillips and Rappeport). If President Trump’s trade war continues then the economy will likely fall again and future presidents will be faced with finding a solution. The legacy of those presidents will be based on their ability to solve the economic problem. As New Yorkers, we have to be wary of a recession. We are at the center of American economy and any economic hardships of the country always have a detrimental effect on the city. The general attitude of the people would be bitter and hostile. For now, we can watch the economy flourish and hope that a possible recession can be avoided.   Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/04/business/yield-curve-recession-stock-market.html?fbclid=IwAR1a2-kXWHgInkj18c137JTcX-qaljExrE3HMuH7CazX7qdC6cNAGSHUFwk
data.post_title: Stock Market Falls as "Tariff Man" Leads a Trade War

More specifically, the S&P 500 declined more than three percent and a large company such as Boeing fell 4.9 percent (Phillips and Rappeport). The events of the past two days clearly signal that the trade war between China and the United States will continue and a long-term agreement is may not happen. The authors express deeper concerns with the stock market as it is showing signs of a possible recession in the near future. If the trend of the stock market continues then the interest rates on long-term United States government bonds will fall below short-term US government bonds. According to the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco, this type of activity has led to, “nine recessions since 1955.” The global economy is in a generally declining with the exception of the United States. Since the United States is a major party in global trade, it is expected that the American economy will also fall. President Trump is a self-proclaimed economic genius, but engaging in a trade war is never beneficial to the economy. If the United States and China reach a long-term trade agreement, then the world economy would likely recover. Investors will regain their confidence and the stock market will rise. The true legacy of a president is determined by their economic achievements. As of today, unemployment is historically low and the economy is set to have its best year since 2005 (Phillips and Rappeport). If President Trump’s trade war continues then the economy will likely fall again and future presidents will be faced with finding a solution. The legacy of those presidents will be based on their ability to solve the economic problem. As New Yorkers, we have to be wary of a recession. We are at the center of American economy and any economic hardships of the country always have a detrimental effect on the city. The general attitude of the people would be bitter and hostile. For now, we can watch the economy flourish and hope that a possible recession can be avoided.   Source: https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/04/business/yield-curve-recession-stock-market.html?fbclid=IwAR1a2-kXWHgInkj18c137JTcX-qaljExrE3HMuH7CazX7qdC6cNAGSHUFwk

data.post_content: Zhenfeng (Remus) Liang 12/06/18 Recently the hedge fund Pershing Square Capital Management L.P. claimed it had acquired 10.9 million Hilton shares, which is a 3.7% stake of Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc. In 2017, the current ratio of the company is 90%, which is much higher than Marriot International’s 46%. It shows that Hilton has a better ability to meet its short-term obligations. Report shows that the potential capacity of the company is high. Conversions from non-Hilton brands represented more than 20 percent of the new rooms opened during the quarter. Revenue per available room (RevPAR) is increasing. System-wide comparable RevPAR increased 2.0 percent on a currency neutral basis for the third quarter from the same period in 2017, showing its ability to fill in the rooms are improving. Given the good financial positions of the company and the continuously improving business performance compared to its competitors, we can be optimistic about the future performance of Hilton Worldwide and its share price.   Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/ackmans-pershing-square-takes-3-7-stake-in-hilton-worldwide-1540478665

Goldman Sachs Group Inc is purchasing a small stake in General Catalyst for approximately $200 million. General Catalyst is a venture capital firm that makes early-stage and growth equity investments.General Catalyst’s current holdings include Airbnb Inc, Bustle and Admirals Bank.  The deal will be done through the Goldman’s Petershill unit. Goldman’s Petershill unit is incharge of making investments in mid-sized asset management firms. Although the deal will entitle the investment bank to a proportion of the profits the venture capital firm generates through carried interest and management fees, Goldman Sachs will not have influence over the firm’s operations or special access to portfolio company information. For now, it is not clear whether the deal has been completed, but it is known that the founders of General Catalyst are not expected to leave as a result of the deal.

I think it is a good step for Goldman Sachs to purchase General Catalyst. The Petershill unit seems to be very promising to the future of the company. It is impeccable that Goldman Sachs was able to raise 2.5 billion to buy stakes in different companies, such as Accel KKR, and Westbrook Partners. Now with the General Catalyst deal, seems it will generate more money coming into to Goldman. I am interested to see whether this purchase will have an effect on the companies stock market. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/goldman-sachs-to-buy-200-million-stake-in-general-catalyst-1543887667

Subrina Oaishe 12/07/18
“Ping An Insurance Group Co. of China and partners in August sold a 13-story Boston office building for $450 million”
In the past recent years, there has been an increase of Chinese investors in the American real-estate market with billions of dollar worth of investments in large metro areas around the country. According to WSJ “insurers, conglomerates and other big investors from China sold $1.05 billion worth of U.S. real estate in the third quarter, while purchasing $231 million of property”. Majority of the time the real estate that are bought by these investors are in crowded cities like “New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Chicago”.
“Shopping-center landlord Site Centers Corp.said last week it sold an 80% stake in 10 shopping centers to two unnamed Chinese institutions that valued the property portfolio at around $607 million”
Chinese investors are buying these properties at high steep prices, thus raising values of other real estate left in the market. However, the recent purchasing power has seen a down low compared to the first two quarters since 2017. Purchasing powers of 2017, first and second quarters were met with good results with the amount of purchase going well beyond $1.7 billion to $4 billion and on the first quarter of 2018 amount of purchase skyrocketing beyond $4 billion. But the third quarter results of 2018 have been tragically low with purchases of only $231 million. The reason for this steep decrease can be described by the “rising corporate debt levels and concern over currency stability [that] led the Chinese government to tighten capital outflows and clamp down on their companies’ overseas acquisitions” and also by the “trade tension between Beijing and Washington, D.C.”.
“The Chinese conglomerate purchased the eight-acre parcel in 2014 for $420 million and had planned to develop luxury condominiums and a boutique hotel on the site”
Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/chinese-dumped-1-billion-of-u-s-real-estate-in-third-quarter-extending-recent-retreat-1543924802

data.post_content: Harleen Ghuman 12/07/18 Last week, President Trump has criticized the Federal Reserve for enjoying their role of threatening U.S. economic growth by increasing interest rates very quickly. The Fed’s reasoning behind raising interest rates is to avoid a pathway to recession through a “boom-and-bust economy”. This puts the Fed’s credibility at risk if the policies they have implemented have gone awry.  Federal Reserve Vice Chairman for Supervision Randal Quarles defended the Fed’s opinion and decision with handling the monetary policy. Quarles analytically defends the Fed while explaining that relations with Congress have been great. The “data” positively reflects the employment and inflation goals laid out by Congress, something Trump has repeatedly neglected of happening. In the past year, the Fed has increased interest rates, it is expected to see these rates rise again later this month. Despite what any outside sources may say or argue against, the Fed has no intention of changing their outlook on these policies. The Fed’s leader claims that the short-term interest rates that the Fed has set puts a neutral impact on the economy, allowing them to reach their goal, compared t the rates that were set in October. Quarles notes that the only change that has occurred is in regards to the perspectives and various standpoints on where the neutral rates should lie. The response instigated by Randal Quarles is the simple mechanism of defense. In my opinion, this situation just seemed as if Quarles is still trying to defend his and the Fed’s decision based on monetary policy. If the Fed wants to increase interest rates to help neutralize the economy and sees it fit to prevent any economic disaster to occur, then by all means this move is fine. I do feel that it’s important to adjust the monetary policy accordingly with the new legislations and work along with Congress. With the soft inflation that is in occurrence along with a slowed boosting economy, the increase in rates should be taken into consideration. The rates shouldn’t change drastically in a short amount of time. Political opinions aside, Trump may have a point when he says the change in rates is causing the economy to slow down, although instead only partial credit should be given to the rate. There are multiple endings to this situation, but only time will tell. Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/feds-quarles-economy-shows-fed-is-doing-a-good-job-with-monetary-policy-1543849343

Amazon is the world’s largest online retailer and a prominent cloud services provider. Amazon has consistently been able to take over many industries. Its ability to provide free 2 day shipping on most products, a streaming and music service, and 2 hour delivery from local supermarkets for its subscription makes the typical American feel like they are in good hands. Most things that people might want to buy, furniture, electronics, school supplies, most likely have a cheaper option on amazon.com. Recently, Amazon has been diving into the clothing business as they are attempting to provide good quality yet affordable clothing to the average consumer. In addition to their expansion into other industries, Jeff Bezos, the founder of amazon.com, made the decision to dive into the health and medicine industry. Right off the bat, getting the correct medicine delivered to anyone will make many family’s lives easier. Amazon is working with an app developed by Xealth Inc. that enables doctors to choose medical supplies to recommend to patients and to direct them to a website that links to amazon.com, where anyone is able to order it. “We’re looking for ways to make that more convenient,” says Glenn Updike, an obstetrician at the UPMC health system in Pittsburgh who has sent the digital referrals and is a technology official at the health system. The app alerts patients with a pop-up disclaimer that buying products is a recommendation only. Amazon outlines how it collects data from users in its privacy policies. Xealth says the app doesn’t share with Amazon any information in a patient’s medical records or about the doctor treating the patient. I think this is a great step for Amazon. They can definitely take on this challenge and take over another industry. Also, It will now be easier for me and my family to get the  medicine we need when we are busy which is a plus. However, I fear for the power Amazon has. They are on top of every industry, which makes me wonder how they can use that to their advantage while putting us, the consumers, as risk. Higher prices for us come with the amount of power that Amazon has.

Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-makes-inroads-selling-medical-supplies-to-the-sick-1543487401?emailToken=0ee81b8a4b33d24ea44f1541b15957b2AVtNY%2002UJF%204YSsKxZ%2FJb0D6Kff0nCgetCShcxtu6F7l6r6QsvELJ8VxrYqWYSS%2F8DXpDNFysDWrwp4gPc2%20CVp%2Fx82qo9uxfEr5tCv6XtRvsSjQTeio0w95iToauNQ&reflink=article_imessage_share&fbclid=IwAR1QwbgIjchLhUcmDHuKAqomKosB1dq2h1zegZ1x0POERYC-4P5vvzz-YYs

data.post_content: Deanna Pisacreta 12/07/18 Fiat Chrysler Automobiles recently announced new plans to convert an engine plant in Detroit to a factory to produce a new Jeep model. This new model will be a seven passenger, bigger than any current Jeep model. The design is in response to a shift in consumer tastes that are trending toward sport-utility vehicles and pickup trucks due to low gasoline prices.  This is also telling that most consumers are assuming gas prices will remain low for an extended period of time. Fiat Chrysler is betting this trend will not change anytime soon, as they announced in June that they will be adding three new Jeep models by 2022, including a pickup truck set to be in production next year. In addition to adding the factory in Detroit, the automaker announced back in January that they would be spending $1 billion to move the production of large pickup trucks from Mexico to a factory in Michigan. This move will add 2,500 new jobs in the United States. The growth of the Jeep brand is shocking during what is being called the “green era”. Millennials are more focused on the environment than ever, yet trends are still in favor of the non-eco-efficient trucks and SUVs. Jeep is one of the few auto brands that are still growing in the United States, set to sell about two million Jeeps this year. However, this may not prove as environmentally detrimental as some might believe. The Gladiator pickup to be in production next year will have several battery-powered variants, something Jeep has yet to put on the market. Fiat Chrysler’s continued job creation in the United States has gained them high praises from President Trump. His administration ran largely on the promise of job creation, and it is a promise the automaker is intending to fulfil. Source:https://www.nytimes.com/2018/12/06/business/fiat-chrysler-jeep-detroit.html

Rich people have realized the abundance of people who are coming in to make a living or just stay for the weekend. They recognize the money they are able to make off of these people. I stand with the government of New York City on this one. I believe the uniqueness and history of the city should be preserved as much as it can, and if there are no guidelines and rules to follow regarding real estate, wealthy building owners will just continue to use their money towards more residential buildings. data.post_content: Patrick Perrigo 12/16/18 With German Chancellor Angela Merkel stepping down in 2021 and an increase in foreign investments in particular European sectors, France’s President Emmanuel Macron appeared to become the next unifier and leader of the European Union during a period of uncertainty as far-right populism and Russian aggression challenges the stability and efficiency of the EU. Leading Europe’s third-largest economy, President Macron has gradually developed a public persona of perseverance and determination since taking office in May 2017 to achieve France’s economic goals and maintain the country’s status as an influential world power. However, the optimism of President Macron’s leadership and France’s economic image has taken a significant beaten over the past four weeks with the emergence of violent protests by the Yellow Vest movement. Beginning as a public outcry over plans to implement a new gas tax to reduce France’s carbon emissions, the Yellow Vests movement has transformed into a collective rebuke of President Macron’s policies and his failure to address concerns of an increase in the high cost of living and tax cuts for big business and wealthy individuals. Protests and demonstrations have become increasingly violent and destructive, with protestors flipping over and burning cars, looting and damaging buildings, and clashing with police on the streets. These protests have resulted in estimated damages and lost revenues exceeding ten million euros, about $11.4 billion, as stated in the New York Times article “Unrest in France Hinders Macron’s Push to Revive Economy” by Liz Alderman. Additionally, the Bank of France has reduced the country’s estimated fourth-quarter growth from 0.4% to 0.2%. Foreign investors are scared to continue investing into France’s economy during this turbulent period as industries like tourism, agriculture, and retail face enormous losses and setbacks as a result of the violent protestors shutting down roads and businesses. Even though President Macron has announced the elimination of the planned gas tax and promised certain financial measures to help lower-class individuals, these promises do very little for the majority of the protestors who reside in rural areas of the country and are faced with increasing living costs and taxes. President Macron has stubbornly refused to ease up on his business-friendly measures to incentivize business investments by eliminating regulations and providing tax breaks. Such stubborn refusal is further cause for concern that the protests may continue longer and become increasingly violent if new measures are taken. “Shopping-center landlord Site Centers Corp.said last week it sold an 80% stake in 10 shopping centers to two unnamed Chinese institutions that valued the property portfolio at around $607 million”
Chinese investors are buying these properties at high steep prices, thus raising values of other real estate left in the market. Purchasing powers of 2017, first and second quarters were met with good results with the amount of purchase going well beyond $1.7 billion to $4 billion and on the first quarter of 2018 amount of purchase skyrocketing beyond $4 billion. Starbucks plans to start selling some of its drinks through Uber Eat in the future to reach more customers. Starbucks has been facing stress in the American domestic market form various other "high end and lower-cost rivals such as Dunkin’ Brands Group Inc” thus this is a move to establish themselves as a stronger choice from all the others. However, the delivery idea faces some complications such as trying to deliver hot or cold drinks in time to make sure they stay their initial temperature or delivery fees for small orders. Even amongst these dilemmas one of Starbucks’ key market, in China, has faced good reactions from the public. In China, Starbucks “joined with a delivery unit of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd” who helped lower tensions associated with coffee delivery services like “splash-proof lids, delivery containers designed to keep drinks hot or cold and tamper-proof packaging seals or [promises from] dedicated drivers in China...to deliver Starbucks coffee in 30 minutes or less”.

Beside plans of expanding into delivery business Starbucks has been implementing other changes since the past year and promises to do so for the future too. The company has promised to lay off some of its corporate workforces to become more “focused” or as the Chief Executive, Kevin Johnson, said, “We’re simplifying the business to accelerate the velocity of innovation”. Beside this Starbucks has joined with Nestle to sell some of its products in supermarkets and also closed various Teavana stores and implemented stronger customer service through it baristas. Overall, Starbucks is making and putting into action, plans to reach higher customers across the world and define itself as a trusted and thriving coffee business.

Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/starbucks-to-offer-coffee-delivery-across-u-s-as-it-seeks-to-reach-more-customers-11544729828

data.post_content: Arya Sanghavi 12/16/18 Often met with “Doctor” or “Engineer”, parents are often faced with the same reply when they ask their children what they aspire to be when they grow up. It’s not too long before their response changes to “whistleblower”. In an article I recently read, “Bernie Madoff’s Legacy: Whistleblower Inc.” I discovered the prominence of their presence in the corporate world. Ten years ago, Bernard Madoff’s multibillion-dollar Ponzi scheme, the biggest fraud in U.S. history, shocked the financial world. It soon emerged that a forensic accountant, Harry Markopolos, had been alerting regulators for years to Mr. Madoff’s fraud, but no one had listened. At Mr. Markopolos’s urging, the Securities and Exchange Commission created a cash-for-tips program, designed to encourage reports of financial wrongdoing and prevent the lapses in oversight that gave Mr. Madoff free rein. Today, an entire industry is devoted to surfacing tips from company insiders and expert analysts who scrutinize corporate filings. Whistleblower Inc. is the most tangible consequence of the Madoff scandal a decade after the money manager’s Dec. 11, 2008 arrest. Critics say the deluge of those seeking rewards is now overwhelming the system. More than 5,200 tips have been filed this year, compared to 3,000 in 2012. About 53% of all reward requests remain undecided, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis of SEC figures and data obtained from a Freedom of Information Act request. It takes the SEC about two years to decide if a whistleblower’s tip merits a reward, according to a sample of whistleblower award decisions analyzed by The Wall Street Journal. In some cases, the wait is much longer. Ethics are important, in business and especially in life. Big corporate companies are often faced with moral dilemmas and choose the wrong decision, acting unethically. Those who decide to do what’s right are compensated well like whistleblowers are.   Source: https://www.wsj.com/articles/bernie-madoffs-legacy-whistleblower-inc-1544245273
